column4: how can I get basic devel tools for ubuntu (like gcc and all)
apt-get install build-essential
umm... thats the debian name for 'linux-image'... which is in 'main'
I have linux-image installed, still smartlink packages ask for kernel-image
just check this link: http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/BinaryDriverHowto/view?searchterm=smartlink . I've all packages mentioned there already installed, but kernel-image
everything that says 'kernel-image' should read 'linux-image' there... its the same thing.
i've them all, but smartlink package asks for kernel-image
read section 3 under "Compiling the driver"... thanks
for that I need to install smartlink package first, its stuck in dependency problem of some kernel-image
no, you just need to expand the tar.gz, and change the file;.
I got a .deb from here http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/multiverse/s/sl-modem/
file a bug on that package about this... but in the mean time, get the tar.gz.
Ubuntu's kernel package is called 'linux-image', so it _shouldn't_ depend kernel-image
I understand.
is there anyway to get .tar.gz from .deb
umm, well technically... but it would be easier to just download tar.gz on its own  :/
u mean from smartlink itself?
yes... that would probably be as good a place as any to get it  :/
okies, let me try that way
_make_sure_ you file the bug though!
well I need to learn first how to file a bug :)
bugzilla.ubuntu.com ... sign up, and click "new bug"
thanks!
